website_summaries.verdict: A simple oil drain container that works well and has a comfortable handle.
pros: Keeps the oil in when used properly
Durable plastic will last a long time
Shorter height allows it to fit nicely under smaller cars and motorcycles
Easy to use for a drain and a transport to the recycling station
cons: This oil drain pan only takes about 6 quarts of oil
Make sure it will be large enough for your vehicle before purchase

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for my purposes of changing the oil on my Kawasaki Vulcan Voyager. It definitely fit underneath, but I had to loosen the bike's drain plugs first and then slide the pan underneath and remove the plugs by hand as the clearance was too tight to put a wrench on them under the bike with the drain container in place. I also had to use a secondary receptacle to put under the filter, but all in all I did not spill a drop. The Matrix Container worked good and held all the oil from the bike.
customer_reviews.author: BlackDogTX

customer_reviews.title: A Little Small
customer_reviews.text: It works well, but after draining ~5.6 quarts (VW Jetta) any pressure on the top squeezes oil up out of the catch hole, so cleaning the top is a little tough. The decline to the catch hole is also a little flat so a fairly significant amount doesn't drain to the hole (hence the need to clean by pushing it there). Other than that, it's good. The screw tops for the drain and fill are better than others I've had, and pouring from container was clean.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tolliver

customer_reviews.title: Not worth he the cost
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed. Was hoping for a better product at this price point. I liked it's low profile so it fit under my motorcycle well, but the drain angle isn't very good. If you don't line it up perfectly oil sprays everywhere as it bounces off the pan. Also, not that there is no screen or filter at the plug hole where the oil drains in. Yep, my drain bolt fell right in...you can imagine how fun that was fishing it out with some needle nose pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for motorcycles!
customer_reviews.text: I dumped 6 quarts into this thing no problem. It would have taken more, I'd guess up to 10 quarts. The stopper cap on the side where the oil drains fits perfectly in the handle groove while the oil drains so you don't have to worry about it blocking the flow into the container. Be careful not to let your drain plug fall because there is no screen and it will go down into the container requiring you to get a magnet to fish it out. Small, compact, I love it! Will get a lot of use from me.
customer_reviews.author: RamboDog

customer_reviews.title: Re-purpose for camper van basin
customer_reviews.text: My camper van has no plumbing system, so I ordered the oil drain container to use as a mini-basin. The container acts as a shallow basin, with a plug into the storage cavity below. If I need more water than the shallow basin accommodates, I use a bowl on top. Either way, the waste water can be dumped into the storage cavity. It's great for doing dishes, brushing teeth, washing hands or whatever. The container allows me to store my wastewater until I find spot for disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Rah

customer_reviews.title: Great price works fine under a triglide.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do my Harley trike. I performed a 3 hole service and it held everything fine. It's a little tall but does fit under the frame. But at that price its worth having to do a quick switch to catch the oil. It held 6 quarts no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Greg D.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping it would fit under my Victory Hammer bike but its a bit too big. Nonetheless, I just emptied my oil into some pans and then put into this container. Either way it serves its purpose. Well made and is just what I needed for my oil changes.
customer_reviews.author: Gill Grylls

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted !
customer_reviews.text: I had an almost identical one that finally fell apart after about 20+ years. This is the perfect replacement and if it functions like the other one, I'll be perfectly happy. Thanks Amazon ! Rick M.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I originally got this to drain the oil on my Harley Davidson. Shame on me for not measuring my ground clearance, but this does not fit under the bike, in case anyone else was wondering (Iron 883 for reference). Otherwise, it does what its supposed to. Like others have said, the oil does splash, and make sure you open the cap to vent or else it will splash and bubble and cause a big mess. Also, "clear" is not clear, it is also translucent white so I don't know what the difference is between the two.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan G.

customer_reviews.title: It can possibly overflow, so watch out, but otherwise it's ok.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't remove the side cap of this container prior to removing the drain plug bolt on my Toyota Tacoma and I REGRETTED IT since the drain cap fell into the hole and I couldn't stop the flow of oil. It was like a bad sitcom skit. Why on earth doesn't the fill hole have a screen built in like many other oil catchers? Watch out when you use this thing. The positive is that is stands on it's side and doesn't seem to leak, although I didn't fill it near to it's capacity. It holds 5.5Q/5.2L well enough and probably some more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful carrying handle
customer_reviews.text: I use a larger drain pan for engine oil and ATF oil changes, then dump the old oil into this container and recycle it at the local auto parts store. Very useful carrying handle, and can sit flat on the sides opposite to the handle and draining area. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little gray water tank
customer_reviews.text: I am using this as a gray water collector in my camper van. Fits perfectly (the only one I could find with the required measurements) and does the job. I would have preferred the cap were standard gas can size. That would allow me to attach a spout, which would make it easier to empty. But since I am not using it for its designated purpose, I hesitate to take off a star.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: No leaks
customer_reviews.text: Kept oil from leaking out. The drain plug does not have a grate to stop bolts from going into the can. While the oil did splash around a bit when draining it eventually started going in well. You will have to wipe the side to clean up the oil after you've got it in.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: invaluable for lawn mower and snow blower oil changes
customer_reviews.text: With my seasonal snowblower and lawn mower oil changes, this container decreases the amount of mess and spillage that can happen. Has an oil intake on the flat side, with the sides sloped toward drain. When full, I open the top drain and fill an empty windshield fluid plastic gallon container up with the old oil and take it for recycling. For yard equipment this is an ideal size. Too small for auto use.
customer_reviews.author: J LaDue

customer_reviews.title: Great for motorcycle oil change
customer_reviews.text: Did the first oil change on my Kawasaki Ninja motorcycle. This made it very easy. I love that you can cap it off to store old oil in there too. Don't forget to wrap foil around your pipes when removing the oil filter!
customer_reviews.author: hungrymanTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: this oil drain works great! its the perfect size for both my scion ...
customer_reviews.text: this oil drain works great! its the perfect size for both my scion tc and my Kawasaki ninja. i wouldn't use it for anything more than 4 or 5 quarts. This allows you take off both caps so that the air can escape and not cause it to overflow. I have dropped my motorcycles oil drain screw in it already and had to dump the oil into another container with a funnel to get it out. other than that this is a really great product.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: I like that it is translucent so that you can see ...
customer_reviews.text: Has worked well for me so far. Remember to loosen the side (top) screw lid a bit when you are draining oil into it from your car. By doing so, you'll eliminate some sputtering when the oil goes into the container (for air escaping the container). I like that it is translucent so that you can see the oil level while it is filling. After draining the oil, I transfer the oil into the 5qt oil container that came with new oil for recycling (I don't transport with this collection container in my car because the local oil recycle center sometimes just has me the leave the old oil for them to pour into the recycle drum/vat).
customer_reviews.author: E. Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Interesting product and great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Unique product that works just as others have already described, had an issue where first product I received was missing valve plug and vendor took care of it quickly, great customer service to go with product!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: What a great solution!
customer_reviews.text: I just used mine for the first nice. What a great solution! The only problem I found is I now have to figure out a new way to spill oil on the driveway. With one of these, you virtually can't make a mess. I would suggest you get a big funnel and save the windshield wiper fluid bottles to transfer the oil for disposal. I'm off to figure out a new way to make a mess, because the old way is gone now! How will I ever get She Who Must Be Obeyed to believe I was actually working changing oil?
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. I had to add a small breather hole so fluid will drain smoothly without overflowing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This oil container is perfect for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: Handy! I did an oil change on my Honda Goldwing recently and this is the prefect height and width. The capacity was just right for my 5 quart waste and nothing leaked out. I like the expansive well to drain the oil. My old one was too small and it was like a game to get the container under where the oil was draining before it got to the ground. Worth the cost and I think it will be the last container I need to buy.
customer_reviews.author: David Simone

customer_reviews.title: Nothing nastier than spent Crankcase Oil.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing worse than nasty spent crankcase oil. Works great. When it’s full take it to *allmart and the auto department will dispose of the spent oil for free.
customer_reviews.author: Farrok

customer_reviews.title: No fuss, no mess!
customer_reviews.text: No fuss, no mess. Great for small jobs, like snowblowers, edgers, etc. Drain it, wipe it off, and take to the auto parts store to recycle (just the oil, not the whole container :-) ) Tried the simple pan before and what a mess. That pan went in recycle! If you do any of your own oil changing, you'll love this.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gill

customer_reviews.title: Small profile, just be sure your vehicle doesn't have more than 4 or 5 quarts of oil!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say anything negative about this -- it has a shorter profile, and fits more easily under smaller compact cars. Just be sure your car doesn't have more than 4 or 5 quarts of oil, that's about the capacity of this drain oil container! ---
customer_reviews.author: craigery

customer_reviews.title: Overall fantastic
customer_reviews.text: While I would like it's highest point a half inch lower, it still works. I'm using it for a motorcycle, and when the pan is under the frame, there's hardly any room for a wrench to loosen the drain plug -- but there's room. Works well, and just as described -- and I especially like being able to see through it.
customer_reviews.author: PLG

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my 2.0L car
customer_reviews.text: did one oil change so far with this and it worked just fine. Perfect size container for my engine, No spillage or leaking. If you have a big engine this probably won't work as you will need a larger container.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. Using to collect hydraulic fluid from ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Using to collect hydraulic fluid from a slow leak so I can reuse. I place a funnel with paper filter in the container inlet to collect and reuse the hydraulic fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Rosydoo

customer_reviews.title: If you have a lawn mower this product is perfect for use in draining the oil
customer_reviews.text: If you have a lawn mower this product is perfect for use in draining the oil. I used it and it was great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Hitchcock

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money but Could be Beter
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should but the funnel area is a little shallow so the oil will slash. I would have given it five stars if it was less than $12. One thing to keep in mind is to slightly unscrew the opening near the handle to let the air escape while to oil is draining into the container.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, would be a five if a little more heavy duty but fills the bill.
customer_reviews.author: johnt650

customer_reviews.title: It slides under my bike and I can drain oil easily. With the cap on the bottle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drain pan because it was narrower than anything else I could find. It slides under my bike and I can drain oil easily. With the cap on the bottle, I can pour the used oil into a jug to take to the recycler. This product works very well and is heavy duty. Should last a long time. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Novus

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Was bent when arrived but wqs able to (mostly) bump out the dent. Works good but plastic is a bit thinner than other oil trays.
customer_reviews.author: R Mac

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Handy pan, doesn't leak along the seam. Makes recycling old oil clean and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Knutty McAwesomepants

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. No muss, no fuss. Can't complain. Use it to drain the lawnmower oil twice a year.
customer_reviews.author: E.M.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best oil drain pan I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is the best oil drain pan I've ever used. I only wish it was bigger because my wife's 4runner isn't the best aim when it drains.
customer_reviews.author: Another ShopperTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Works well but doesn't hold much oil
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to have an oil pan that also serves as a can to transport the waste oil. My only issue would be that it doesn't hold much oil but I knew that when I bought it so I can't really complain.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: simple oil drain container. no complaints it works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Luckeelady

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what you need
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, it's an oil pan. It is good quality and catches the oil. I can store the oil until I can take it to a deposit.
customer_reviews.author: M_user

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and good product. I like the low profile because it fits underneath my motorcycles. Be careful of spatter but it does work well.
customer_reviews.author: Bishop

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that I can see the oil level ...
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected. I like the fact that I can see the oil level from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle T.

customer_reviews.title: perfect, not an issue, no complaints, get one for yourself
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no issues in any way. Highly recommended by me for a personal or even small business oil catch pan. Slid right under my motorcycle without any issues and took five quarts like a charm. Easy to clean because I can see what's dirty. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Robert Golden

customer_reviews.title: Makes it easy to drain and store my oil
customer_reviews.text: Makes it easy to drain and store my oil. The plastic cleans up nicely with a paper towel and the caps are secure and don't leak.
customer_reviews.author: DrewG

customer_reviews.title: Drain Hole too small, Pan not deep enough.
customer_reviews.text: I found that it was not deep enough and the drain hole not large enough to capture all the oil as it first started to drain. I have used it several times and each time I have made a mess on the garage floor. I am finally going to retire this and get another one. I would suggest anyone who is needs to drain more than a could of quarts from a small hole to steer away from this product. Look for something more robust.
customer_reviews.author: Barry W. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. Easy to fill with oil, oil-proof, mostly smell-proof, and easy to drain oil out of when the time comes. I'd get it again.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Gurle

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Got this to drain the oil in my motorcycle, works perfectly. plugs fit well to seal the holes when you go to pour, and doesn't seem to have any issues. low profile so it fits without too much hassle as well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vos

customer_reviews.title: Not outdoor friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Don't ever leave this out exposed to the sun. Living in LA... these things don't fair even a few months in the sun. Thing cracked instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works well under my Goldwing.
customer_reviews.text: Great container, works very well. Fits fine under my Honda Goldwing. Makes changing oil non-messy and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Miller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did my first Motorcycle oil change and the oil pan worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ricketts

customer_reviews.title: Great for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: Fits under my kawasaki vulcan s Motorcycle. Does a great job and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Gadsen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I use this for oil changes on my bike, and it's the perfect size and height, fits under the drain plug and oil doesn't splash anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: lappyuser

customer_reviews.title: I know the specs are in the description
customer_reviews.text: But it's much smaller than I'd expected. This is the first one I've bought online and it's smaller than the ones you'll typically find in auto stores. I would guarantee a mess every time but i think it's a lot more likely with this.
customer_reviews.author: unnamed at this time

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but may leak a little when stored upright.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Its an oil pan
customer_reviews.text: Plug leaks a little but held all 6 quarts from my Titan. Worth it
customer_reviews.author: Wintz

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Simply does what it needs to do. Good size, works nicely.
customer_reviews.author: UK

customer_reviews.title: can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: slim, low profile container thats easy to see how much is inside. some volume indicators would be nice, but not a deal breaker. durable plastic and beefy cap (usual point of failure)
customer_reviews.author: Gabe A

customer_reviews.title: Catches oil
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my first oil change. What can I say, works as expected!
customer_reviews.author: TJ Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: I have a lowered Kawasaki concours 14 and my other ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a lowered Kawasaki concours 14 and my other drain pans wouldn't clear, bike holds 5 qts and there room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: works and doesn't leak
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my motorcycle. I wish it was like 2-3 inches longer. It won't catch the oil dripping from both bolts.. Good product though.. No leaking
customer_reviews.author: jakebuck

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: Works great but be warned it has no gasket to seal in oil so it may leak vut for the price i couldnt complain
customer_reviews.author: jonny2tim3

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for low clearance oil changes
customer_reviews.text: Very nice for low clearance oil changes. It probably needs an air hole as oil slows down a little when almost full.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo A. Santos

customer_reviews.title: great job so
customer_reviews.text: caught all the oil without popping open. great job so far
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Handily catches the oil when it first shoots out, easy to clean. Plastic is sturdy and handle easy to grip.
customer_reviews.author: AL182

customer_reviews.title: The Only Oil Drain Container that actually works!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Quality construction. There is simply no good alternative to this excellent product. You cannot go wrong with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in Garner NC

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its nice and works, price is fair. Not much to say about it. Its a drain pan.
customer_reviews.author: Overlord

customer_reviews.title: best drain pan
customer_reviews.text: This is buy far the best built drain pan I have ever owned. Very sturdy and easy to empty. I only wish this was available in a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: COVER THE BOTTOM WITH CARDBOARD OR IT WILL WEAR THROUGH
customer_reviews.text: Good for a FIVE QUARTS OR LESS oil change. Also, I suggest you put a piece of cardboard under this pan each time you use it. I wore the first one out by sliding under and from under my car and my concrete floors in my garage wore the plastic through and it then leaked. .I now bought another one but I now duct tape a piece of cardboard to the bottom so that sliding it on concrete doesn't wear through the plastic
customer_reviews.author: Tony NYCTop Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: it's OK
customer_reviews.text: This pan works but the catch pan is too small so I had some mess to wipe up. Other than that it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Matrix concepts
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this isn't getting five stars is because the drain hole is the perfect size for the nut that holds back the oil. Once the bolt slid down into the whole and stopped the oil from draining properly, which promptly overflowed and got oil everywhere! That being said, when the nut is placed away this works great. It collects the oil wonderfully and all it needs is a quick wipe with a paper towel when your done.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ness

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good. A little thin, but probably tougher than I think it is. Bought it for my motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: John Harley Seidel

customer_reviews.title: Matrix Concepts M28 Oil Drain Container
customer_reviews.text: This container has a conveniently low format, simple to use, made of strong material, and cleans up easily. I recommend it to anyone looking for a handy oil drain container.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Wish there were some gaskets on the caps - they leak if it tips over.
customer_reviews.author: Rawr

customer_reviews.title: Adequate Oil Drain With a Couple Issues
customer_reviews.text: The design is good, but I had a couple issues. Despite being designed for motorcycles, it wouldn't fit under my bike (VRSCDX). Also, when I started draining the oil it couldn't keep up and oil overflowed the pan's drain area on top and spilled into the driveway (and we all hate that).
customer_reviews.author: D. C. Reeder

customer_reviews.title: If feels much better maid than the black plastic one I had before
customer_reviews.text: this was for 6 quarts, If you have a car with 6 quarts on oil in it you really should get the bigger model. the air escapes buy removing the drain cap. oil splashed out when I was draining the oil out of my car. If feels much better maid than the black plastic one I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Mushu

customer_reviews.title: Way too small.
customer_reviews.text: Only holds 6 quarts. Just barely enough for one oil change per vehicle. Too pricey for what it is. I wish the description was clearer on the oil capacity as there's no mention of it as I recall.
customer_reviews.author: Wen H. Lin

customer_reviews.title: beats cheaper alternatives i've tried.  worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: works as intended. the plus to this one over a cheaper alternative i previously bought at the local auto store, is that the caps from the drain holes on this M28 sits snug - no leaking during transport.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy Over Here

customer_reviews.title: Better than zip lock bags or your hands
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. It's a container, it holds oil, and it has a screw on cap. If you need to hold oil, this is better than a cardboard box or your hands.
customer_reviews.author: elliott

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is truly fabulous. Used it for oil change on my 2016 Aprilia Tuono. Caught all the oil when it jizzed out of the oil pan. Great product and stores the oil.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Too small to be useful, even for small cars
customer_reviews.text: This canister wasn't wide enough to capture the oil draining at an angle from my Mazda 2. Oil splashed all over my garage floor. It also wasn't wide enough to stay under both the drain plug and the oil filter. My old pan was large enough to capture all the oil and keep my garage floor clean. I drained the oil out of this and threw it in the garbage. My Mazda 2 has one of the smallest car engines sold in North America, so if it's too small for me it's too small for most any car. You might find this more useful for motorcycles or lawnmowers, maybe?
customer_reviews.author: Fireboy

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Be warned. We ordered an oil pan for changing oil and received sunglasses made from bpa plastic with a warning that the materials are known to cause cancer.. Contacted seller but no response.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Probst

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to drain old oil into the 5 Liter container that had your new oil. Use a funnel.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Because oil goes everywhere when you pull the plug it would be great if this thing was larger to catch the drips ...
customer_reviews.text: Needs to be thinner and longer it barely fits under my street glide. Because oil goes everywhere when you pull the plug it would be great if this thing was larger to catch the drips that run down the frame. It works though. I keep my old used oil for starting fires and fertilizing my neighbors lawns...
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a little bigger. The specs should be a little more clearer. If you plan on changing 2 cars in same day have the option of emptying it out because it only hold 10 qts. Both my cars hold 6 each.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C Wheatley

customer_reviews.title: Matrix Concepts M28 100
customer_reviews.text: i did my oil change at my bros. house he had this iteam could not find it at my auto parts store. so i found it on amazon love this alot better then the old type oil pan that i was useing.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Too tall
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would fit under my motorcycle, but it was about 1/2" too tall. Appears to be well made, but had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: buckmasters

product_meta.title: Matrix Concepts M28 Oil Drain Container, Clear
product_meta.description: Color:ClearEasy to use oil drain container with a built in low profile drain pan.
feature_bullets: Oil drain pan with a built-in container
Screw on cap and plug provides a tight, positive seal
Features an extra-large handle for a comfortable and secure grip
Easy to store, carry and empty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars159 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
